sourceMeaningMnemonic: You accidentally stab your <radical>cross</radical> into the <radical>eye</radical> of a <radical>lion</radical>. This is a terrible thing you did and you need to <kanji>fix</kanji> it right now. I'll be <kanji>direct</kanji> with you, this is something you have to fix on your own.
meaningInfo: How will you fix this mistake though? Maybe if you build a time machine you can go back and stop yourself from throwing your cross around so carelessly. Whatever you do, focus on how important it is to fix the mistake, more than anything.
readingMnemonic: As you try to <kanji>fix</kanji> the lion's eye, it starts to <reading>choke</reading> (<ja>ちょく</ja>) and make what can only be described as a <reading>jiki</reading>jikijiki sound (<ja>じき</ja>). Through its choking jikijiki sounds, it coughs up a gear. Wait. Is this a machine lion?
readingInfo: You're relieved! You don't know how to fix a choking, eye-stabbed lion, but you can absolutely fix a ROBOTIC one. Robots are fixable.
